data.title: Ferrari Factory Tour | Ferrari Museum Tour
data.meta_description: ITALIAN FACTORY MOTOR TOUR organizes the Ferrari Factory Tour and Ferrari Museum Tour in Maranello to see the most famous brand of sports cars in the world
data.text:
Italian Factory Motor Tour organizes theFerrari Factory Tour and the Ferrari Museum Tour and offers you the chance to visit the Museum and the Factory of the most famous "red myth" of Maranello. The Ferrari Museum is a dynamic exhibition that is constantly renewed over time. In addition to the permanent exhibition of the most significant historical pieces, including the first Ferrari and the 125 S of 1947, the Museum offers the most recent models as well as temporary exhibitions dedicated to the most significant moments of Ferrari History and production. Also it's possible enjoy an exclusive shuttle bus tours to the Fiorano Track and along the Viale Enzo Ferrari boulevard in the factory complex. In Modena, a few kilometers from Maranello, there is the Enzo Ferrari Museum not to be missed: while the Maranello museum is a must for sports car races and Formula 1 enthusiasts, the Modena Museum - MEF - is an engaging and exciting exhibitionis dedicated to its founder Enzo Ferrari.

The FERRARI MUSEUM, located just 300 metres from the FERRARI FACTORY in Maranello, is a Ferrari Company Museum dedicated to the Ferrari Sports car marque. The Museum doesnât collect only the most famous Ferrari cars, but it also exhibits prizes, trophies, photographs and other historical objects related to the history of the great Italian car brand. Among the most attractive display rooms is that boasting approximately 40 prestigious models on rotation, deriving from museums and private collectors; the models show off the evolution of Ferrari style and design. Then, a hall dedicated to Formula One and Cavallino, the Victory Hall, celebrates the victories of the Scuderia, displaying World Championship cars from 1999 to 2008, 110 trophies, and the original helmets from nine World Champion Drivers: like Villeneuve, Berger, Mansell and Prost. Also visible are numerous other items belonging to the drivers, including gloves, suits and shoes. Also a big draw is an authentic reconstruction of the Ferrari Formula One Pit, containing the disassembled parts of the latest model, a control center and radio telemetry unit: a must for those who want to live this rare experience. If you want to live the "Myth Red" and give you a special day with Ferrari Factory Tour or the Ferrari Museum Tour click below and visit our tour page:
